conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graphs to determine the maximum distance between the truck and the bus.
Initial conditions: bus is 30 meters ahead of the truck; initial velocities are 40 m/s for the truck and 30 m/s for the bus.
Truck decelerates from 40 m/s to 0 m/s over 20 seconds; bus decelerates from 30 m/s to 0 m/s over 30 seconds.
Calculate deceleration rates: truck's deceleration is -2 m/s², bus's deceleration is -1 m/s².
Calculate distance traveled by truck: s_truck = 40t - t².
Calculate distance traveled by bus: s_bus = 30t - 0.5t².
Determine relative distance: Δs = s_bus - s_truck + 30 = -10t + 0.5t² + 30.
Find maximum relative distance by finding the vertex of the parabola: t = 10 seconds.
Since distance cannot be negative, maximum distance is 0 meters when truck and bus are closest.
